Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; interior: glazed streaky black; top and outside of lip glazed; below, incised lotus and tendrils with added red for the kalyx and central spiked petal.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 227-8, no. B82)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0024) (Phase 1)
